result.execSummary:
The defendant Sarah J Thoman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Harboring/Aiding a Felon (E/F/G/H/I or unclassified felony/not life), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.47(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.   Court authorized payment plan.
Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

marked 1-3 (exhibit 1 and 2)
Guilty (signed) Not Guilty

Defendant in court with Attorney Terry W Frederick.  Robert J Jambois appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marked exhibits 1,2 and 3.  Jurros broughts in at 9:00, jury sworn.  Court reads opening instructions.  Opening statements by ADA Jambois and Atty. Frederick.  Stats calls witness, sworn.  Direct exam by ADA Jambois.  Cross exam by Atty. Frederick.  Witness excused.  State calls DCSO Detective SS, sworn, takes stand.  Direct exam, witness identifies defendant.  States requests judicial notice of exhibits 1 and 2.  Court takes judicial notice.  Cross exam by Att. Frederick.  Witness excused.  State rests at 9:53.  Jurors excused for mid morning break.  Court has colloquy with defendant concerning her right to and the right not to testify.  Defendant chooses to testify.  Jurors brought back in at 10:18.  Atty. Frederick calls defendant, sworn, takes stand.  Direct exam by Atty. Frederick, Cross exam by ADA Jambois, witness excused.  Defense rests.  State has no rebuttal witnesses.  Court starts closing instructions at 10:42.  Clerk picks alternate juror, Clerk calls juror number 163, BS. excused at 10:52.  Closing arguments by ADA Jambois, Atty. Frederick, rebuttal by ADA Jambois.  Clerk swears bailiff at 11:13.  Jurors leave for deliberations at 11:13.  Jury enters with verdict at 11:41 am.  Verdict: GUILTY.  Jury excused at 11:43 am.  Moved to sentencing.
and peremptory challenges

Defendant in court with Attorney Terry W Frederick.  Robert J Jambois appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ludwig, 2 years probation, no jail time with conditions of self esteem building and criminal thinking.  Bail would not be revoked if convicted.  Defendant has rejected offer.  Panel requested, panel up at 11:01, Clerk sworn prospective panel, clerk calls 23 names.  Court reads preliminary instructions, court does voir dire.  Court strikes jur 139, KA.  Clerk calls another name.  Voir Dire completed by ADA Jambois, Voir Dire completed by Atty. Frederick.  Strikes start at 11:41.  Clerk calls 13 names.  Non selected jurors excused at 11:52.  Court reads remaining preliminary instructions.  Jurors to return on Wednesday, June 8, 216 at 8:15 to start at 8:30.  Jurors excused at 11:55.  Atty. Frederick speaks to court in regards to elements of crime to co-defendant, ADA Jambois rebuts.  Court adjourned
and Inspection.
